p: A detailed investigation of the essential oil obtained from P. roxburghii bark cultivated in Egypt applying GC-FID and GC/MS techniques resulted in the identification of 75 components representing 89.65% of the total hydrodistilled oil. The oil is yellow in color with an aromatic odor, giving a yield of 0.022% w/ w of dry plant. The chemical composition of the essential oil was listed in Table 1. The essential oil was predominated by sesquiterpene hydrocarbons accounting for 37.13% whereas monoterpenes, oxygenated monoterpenes, oxygenated sesquiterpenes, and other compounds represent 7.75%, 6.24%, 19.79% and 18.74% of the total oil components, respectively.
